title: There is 0 Point playing Ranked at the moment...
body: Since effectively, I am nerfing myself by not having anybody to group with as a super awesome premade 5 man. I might as well not bother, its not a true indication of individual progress and skill.

replies.body: The bigger problem is that even if you could climb equally well solo, your skill won't be any more recognized since the ranking doesn't differentiate for queue configurations. A guy getting boosted every game in a 4-man and a solo player can both have the same ranking despite how different the experiences/skills may be. Any ladder where you can't directly compare players is broken.

> [{quoted}](name=GoodwilI,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pKbrxBg6,comment-id=001000000000,timestamp=2016-05-13T00:57:12.319+0000)

> League is a team game, team revolved rank is supposed to be projected - not a solo skill rank.

Yes, and it always did in SQ. A large part of your skill IS playing appropriately around your team comp. and the map. This includes your team play, decision making, mechanics and everything in between. The point is that in a real solo queue, the only variable which is consistent in every game is you so the other players cancel each other out long-term and only your own performance remains as the relevant factor. Over a large sample of games, this is the best representation of skill and the least confounded. 

If you add more pre-selected consistent variables to the game like 3 others that said player already knows, has plans developed with, may be on smurfs etc. (in other words, variables in your control which really can't be equalized or fully understood by the system), it adds far more variance in determining actual skill. Think of your skill as solving for x and the main factor that a ranked system is trying to derive in a simplified manner through game results. Each new consistent variable (up to a queue configuration of 5) makes solving for that x harder by adding more variables to factor in. It also greatly increases variance due to the potential pre-selected strategies, voice etc. This is even further amplified by the lack of a sufficient player pool to actually create balanced matchmaking even at Plat+ with 5 mans. IWDominate not long ago had a game where his team was -2000LP in ranking differences. LoL is a huge game but it needs to be even bigger to support DQ and something like DQ will inherently greatly increase the variance which means that you need to play way more games to reach your true skill level than if it was just a SQ system. This can work both ways - some can be much higher than their skill and some much lower, that's the nature of variance. If you had to play 200 games to get a pretty accurate representation of your skill, it's probably more than double in the new system.

BTW: The high variance nature of it is again not even my main problem with it. I simply don't think it's even remotely logical to aggregate every queue configuration on the same ladder. If they care about competitive integrity that's clearly a braindead move which makes ladder results only more ambiguous. It's not that hard to have DQ and just show separate results for each queue configuration.

And I would agree with you if League were a First-Person-Shooter or a solo-player game, but it isn't.  The irony in discussing "individual skill and progress" in a team based game is so obvious and overwhelming that it's hard to even put into descriptive terms.  

If you hate Dynamic Queue, that's fine, but I know the boards/old forums and I know how people would complain like mad if Solo Queue were to ever return.  

"There's no team work"
"No one groups" 
"Why can't I climb?"  

When I read the complaints about Dynamic Queue the majority of the posts just say things like "It's unfair to face a premade duo/trio/quad because they're better coordinated..." Yeah, no kidding - that's what this game is supposed to be, a TEAM based game.  Riot has undergone a paradigm shift with regard to how they approach this game going forward.  It is clear that they are centered the focus on team play, grouping, friends, etc... And if your best argument against it is that it doesn't highlight your INDIVIDUAL skill well then you should prepare yourself for additional disappointment in the years to come.
